fields.description:
*Current behaviour:*
 There is currently no way of identifying who started a sprint.

*Expected behaviour:*
 It would be helpful to have this information available in Jira Software e.g. by clicking on the Sprint details in the Work tab on a Board.

h4. Workaround 
Create automation like [*this one*|https://share.getcloudapp.com/xQunKY41] to log the user who started the sprint. We can also create a rule to send an email to the user who started the sprint. Follow an example in this[ *video.*|https://share.getcloudapp.com/jkuedYmv]
fields.summary: As a member of a scrum team, I'd like to know who started a sprint.

fields.description:
In the Kanban Board, when viewing issues in Work mode (the issue panel on the right side of the screen), it would be help and time-saving if some 'action buttons' or transitions were enabled in the menu, instead of having to do it from the 'Edit' or 'More Actions' button.

Some examples would be 'Assign', 'Resolve', etc.
fields.summary: Include action buttons in Kanban board

fields.description:
Story Points can no longer be Exported nor do they show up in the Bulk Edit

This issue has happened before. Can you please fix it asap and create a test to make sure that it doesn't happen again. I am really frustrated that you have so many regressions. It is really unprofessional.

To reproduce:
1) Select Issues then Search
2) Add the column 'Story Points'
3) Click Export then Excel (Current Fields)
4) Open the Excel, the Story Point column is not there. 
Actual: The Story Points column is missing from the Export. This is a regression as I was able to do see the Story Point column in the Excel export many times before.
Expected: The Story Points column to be exported

Feel free to contact me. I use these fields a lot and need them available.
Edie Hovermale
(650)245-8996 PST
fields.summary: Story Points can no longer be Exported nor do they show up in the Bulk Edit

fields.description:
When using a Scrum or Kanban board for multiple projects, I would like to be able to swimlane automatically by Project.

This would have the effect of grouping stories and epics by project.

Useful for program management, allowing you to see the state of all projects at once but each project would be grouped.
fields.summary: When using a Kanban board for multiple projects, I would like to be able to swimlane by project automatically

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-10293].
  {panel}

Jira 6.1.2
Safari 6.1.1

Steps to repro:
- Log in to Jira
- Visit RapidBoard
- Safari crashes
fields.summary: Safari Crashes on Agile Plan view

fields.description:
In Plan mode, currently the estimated work done is only shown in the popup dialog for the progress bar on the Versions & Epics panels.

It would be much easier for Product Owners to track & report on progress if the estimated work done (& optionally the percentage) was shown directly on the Version & Epic panels (in addition to the existing popup).

-Johnny
fields.summary: Show Estimated work done for Versions & Epics in Plan mode

fields.description:
We use ranking, so the issues in the backlog in that screen shot is ordered by rank. The problem is displaying only the relevant (e.g. top 10 ranked) issues from each project in the sprint planning mode.
Ideally the backlog could display 10 issues from project A, then 10 issues from project B, and so on, and ignore the hundreds of other issues in those projects.

(y) Ordering by two fields was a very useful tip. The closes I have come now is:
{{updatedDate > -7d and resolution = unresolved and  project in (AAA, BBB, CCC) order by project, rank desc}}

(n) I added {{updatedDate > -7d}} to avoid having hundreds of issues from the first project displayed above the second project. But what I really want is the top ten ranked. Using updatedDate will give several irrelevant issues.
fields.summary: Filter top ten issues from multiple projects in backlog

fields.description: If a issue it moved into the DONE column during a sprint in Agile the issue is displayed striked. The same issue number is not shown striked in a dashboard widget, that shows all issues of the current sprint.
fields.summary: Dashboard & Agile board issue status not in sync

fields.description:
During JIRA development, our internal systems were deployed with a version of JIRA that had a broken JQL parser.  The effect was to make JIRA Agile's welcome and management pages unusable due to an internal server error.

This suggests three separate problems:
# The JQL parser needs to be fixed
# JIRA should be hardened to avoid exposing plugins to undeclared runtime exceptions if unparsable JQL is encountered in the database.  This is important because the ability of OnDemand customers to export and import to their on premise instance means that they could have created search requests (filters) in the OnDemand instance that the on premise instance cannot yet support.
# JIRA Agile should be hardened against exceptions that occur when trying to retrieve a search request (filter).

This last point is what this issue is meant to cover; the other two are being tracked internally by JIRA development.
fields.summary: JIRA Agile is vulnerable to JQL parse exceptions from JIRA
Dragging a ticket to the rightmost lane can cause the board to scroll right

fields.description: Should show the time rolled up to the Epic, from Tasks and Stories that are part of the Epic
fields.summary: As a Scrummaster, I'd like to have time estimates for roll up to epics

fields.description:
In Work mode (say on Kanban board), where the swimlanes are not by "Story" (e.g., when swimlanes are by "Query"), if an issue has a subtask, but they are in different columns, the subtask has a placeholder for the issue.

However, the placeholder for the subtask's parent issue does not indicate issue type (via say icon), nor is it possible to click on the placeholder to find out any detail.

Consider allowing the issue placeholder to be clicked just like the issue itself, hence showing the detail pane.

-Johnny
fields.summary: In Work mode, hard to get parent detail of subtask, when in different columns
I am trying to upgrade from 15 to 50 users and the 'Apply changes' does not work. I need this upgrade by tomorrow morning (9:00 GMT)

fields.description:
Apptio Support Entitlement number (SEN): SEN-2019309 

Our developers like to use Technical Tasks to break down the work involved in a user story.  Unfortunately we can't use them, because they don't show up on the planning tab of a rapid board.  This doesn't make any sense to us - we should be able to see and pull a unit of work onto a sprint.  It shouldn't be hidden by the parent user story.  

When we checked on this earlier we were told this was by design.  
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/108172/planning-sprint-in-greenhopper-6-with-scrum-board-no-subtasks-shown?page=1#251048
This response is not satisfactory and inconsistent with behavior for your JIRA OnDemand product (which does allow you to view Technical Tasks) in planning mode.  Please address this.  

The suggestion that we repurpose Epics to provide this functionality is not a viable option for us.  We already use Epics and it doesn't make sense for us to radically shift how we classify issues to work around what appears to be a bug in your downloadable product.  
Clearly from the above link we're not the only company who wants this fixed.

Ideally (but not required):
1) Tasks should be shown in an hierarchial view under their parent
2) Task points should roll up to a story
Internal reference: SCM-709, SCM-713
fields.summary: Technical Tasks do not show up on the Planning tab of a rapid board

fields.description:
Apptio Support Entitlement number (SEN): SEN-2019309 

Here is a sample repro scenario:
Team ITP creates a Ticket A with in the Sprint 14.01.17 - ITP" on Team ITP Rapid Board.
Team ITP assigns Ticket A to a team member in Reporting team
Reporting team opens 'Team Reporting Rapid Board' and views Ticket A assigned to it under cross team sprint 'Sprint 14.01.17 - ITP'.
Team ITP does not have any visibility into Ticket A on the ITP Rapid Board.
Team ITP searches for Ticket A in JIRA and updates the 'Team' field to 'Planning' . .

Expected Result:
    Ticket A shows up under Sprint 14.01.17 - ITP on Team Reporting Rapid Board
    Ticket A also shows up under Sprint 14.01.-17 - ITP on Team ITP Rapid Board.

Actual Result:
    Ticket A disappears from Sprint 14.01.17 - ITP on Team Reporting Rapid Board.
    Ticket A shows up under Sprint 14.01.-17 - ITP on Team ITP Rapid Board

Oddly, issue state appears to be a factor as well.  In the above example, tickets in an active state are not shown on the Team Reporting Rapid board when they are active, but when they are in a resolved or closed state they do.
Note - we considered disabling the Team field but found we need it to:
1) Filter out tickets on a Rapid board for resources that are shared across multiple teams
2) Ensure individual team rapid boards with resources on multiple teams have accurate reporting (by filtering out only the bugs that apply to that team). 
Internal reference: SCM-826, SCM-791
fields.summary: JIRA: Team field doesn't work for cross team sprint tickets

fields.description:
Currently in the task board, the ranking of the sub-tasks is restricted by the parent issue of those sub-tasks. However, in certain situations it's necessary to have this restriction removed. An example of the use case we have here:

 Call ABC-1: parent call to create a piece of software
 Call ABC-2, ABC-3, ABC-4, ABC-5 (sub-task from ABC-1): all three for the development of different parts of the software, one for customer documentation all assigned to different people
 
The people which the calls ABC-2, ABC-3, ABC-4, ABC-5 assigned see only the assigned calls on there agile boards. There is no chance for the users to get the ABC-2 calls above all other calls without re-ranking the complete call ABC-1 which is assigned to the product owner of the software.

It will be nice to have the flexibility for the users to have their issues ranked based on their own boards instead of having the restriction of the parent issue.
fields.summary: Rank of Sub-tasks regardless to the Parent issue.

fields.description:
It should be possible to order backlogs by other values than the rank, such as a field, what is important for the management-level: the "business value" which specified how important a story is for the company. In my company for example, we need to create sprints ordered by the business-value as we firstly need to realize these stories before any others. 
The current JIRA Agile does not offer this opportunity as it only allows the create a new sprint which is ordered by "rank". This is quite static way to create a new sprint, therefor it would be create to be able to create new sprints with other arrangements, such as ordered by the field "business value" or any other custom-field which a user has created for his stories.

I read in forum, that more people are wishing to have this kind of function.

Thank you!
fields.summary: Order Backlog by "Business Value" - not by "Rank"
Enable JQL query: WAS ... DURING (sprint)

fields.description:
It will redirect you to login when your session times out on re-focus of the tab when you have a comment in draft.

It should have been stopped by dirty form warning, but it wasn't.

It should warn me that I've been logged out so I have at least a chance to copy out my data.
fields.summary: JIRA Agile should not refresh the page while a comment is being drafted

fields.description: !https://monosnap.com/image/8UQnDNI25EZPh7CkefrER2gPu.png!
fields.summary: Error on page load in JIRA Agile
404 error when adding field to detailed view.

fields.description:
We use stories (with story points) to manage our sprints, and sub-tasks for the actual to-dos within a sprint (without any estimation). When we configure the agile board to use "Issue Count" for "Estimation", the burndown chart shows the stories completed. It would be nice to (maybe optionally) see the much more fine granular sub-tasks burning down.

I would have thought this was a quite common practice, but I haven't found any similar requests. Some colleagues misuse the time tracking instead, by entering the number of open subtasks as estimated days.
fields.summary: Burndown on Issue Count could include subtasks

fields.description:
If you use the Jira-Agile kanbanboard feature "release..." to set a specific version to the resolved issues and dismiss the resolved issues from the board, no jira event like "update-issue" is triggered, so no notifications are sent to inform reporters/watchers according to the notification scheme

Would be great if *updating* the fix version/s field via Jira-Agile would trigger a *update-issue* event (sounds convenient for me ;) )
or firing any other Event i can configure in a notification scheme
fields.summary: Kanban-Board release... doesn't fire update-issue Event on setting fixversion/s

fields.description:
As of the current feature of the Kanban board, users are able to release a version which are listed under the *Done* column as a whole. What this means is that every issue that are in the column will be released.

However, it will be good if JIRA Agile can introduce an additional feature that allows users to release version per component. This actually helps to manage releases better in such a way that you might have different components that you would like to release in different versions.

The current workaround that is available is to make use of a separate Kanban board for separate releases per components. If this feature is introduced in Kanban, it will provide more flexibility to version release.
fields.summary: As a Kanban board user, I would like to be able to release the version per Component basis

fields.description:
The current [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Adding+an+Issue+to+a+Sprint] requires a user to have project permissions:

* 'Edit Issue'
* 'Schedule Issue'

If a user has these permissions and does *not* have 'Administer Projects' permission the issue will be created, but it will not provide the additional link in the temp. pop-up to 'Add to <sprint name>'.  Instead it will be added to the backlog.

Adding the permission to 'Administer Projects' does allow the 'Add to <sprint name> dialog to be shown.

Without the permission a user can still move the issue from backlog into the active sprint, confirming the functionality and permission does exist.

Examples attached of failed event, manual event and successful event (with additional permission).

*Workaround:*
Manually schedule from 'Backlog' to 'Sprint' in Plan mode
or
Add 'Administer Projects' permission to necessary users
fields.summary: Creating and Adding new issue to active sprint does not work with documented project permissions

fields.description:
It would be great if we can customize the burndown dependency. 
So far, the burndown is based on the rightmost column of the board, which is not so convenient for some scenarios. 
What we need is that the burndown definition can be independent from the column mapping and customizable to base on a specific status / resolution.
fields.summary: Burndown based on status

fields.description:
Currently when you select a quick filter this selection remains on even when you select other filters.

As an admin I would like to change this default to one where this behavior would only occur when you hold a short cut key and make the selection, else by default it will deselect previously selected filter preferring the new selection.  For least disruption to existing users I would prefer this is configurable at the project level vs. global configuration per instance.
fields.summary: Change the default behavior of Quick filter selection stickiness

fields.description:
The current functionality of *JIRA Agile / GreenHopper* defines that the right most column is the column that you use to close issues. However, it will be more flexible if users are able to define their own columns for closing issues.

Also, it will be useful if users can also have more than a single column for closing issues. A good use case is per the following:
* A development team is comprised of several members that are responsible for certain tasks
* The board is configured to have columns such as:
** To Do
** In Progress
** Testing Done
** Development Done
* The members that are responsible for Testing is able to complete / close their tasks by moving them to the *Testing Done* column
* On the other hand, members of the Development shall move their tasks to *Development Done* column

This flexibility will help teams to organize their issues and tasks in a better manner.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to have the ability to define the more than one column to close issues
Issue ranking operation log entry found where none expected should be automatically handled

fields.description: It could be useful if we could another Tab Panel on the left side of the Plan Board like Versions and Epics but for any field. Just like a bulk change but you just need to drag and drop several issues to that category of the new tab.
fields.summary: As User, I would like the ability to add another Tab Panel on the Plan Board

fields.description:
As a Product Owner, I want the stakeholders in my product to be able to rank the issues that they find important to our product independently from other stakeholders. 

Details:
We manage our stakeholders by allowing them to rank their requests in order of importance. Our sales team will have a different list of priorities to our support team for instance. In JIRA Agile Classic, we do this by given them access to a planning board for their issues and associate the context to a Ranking field (e.g. "Sales Rank", "Support Rank", etc.). This allows our stakeholders to drag and drop issues into the order that they find important. These lists are used as input to our sprint planning meeting. The independent ranking fields mean there is no accidental interference between the various stakeholders' lists when moving issues up or down in their own list.

With JIRA Agile, this is no longer possible (due to the fact that there is only one global rank field). We tried this once, but each time a stakeholder changes the ranking of an issue in their list, it has a side effect of changing the rank in other lists (due to the fact the ranking is global). This led to prioritisation chaos. 

The lack of support for our use case(s) forces us to use JIRA Classic. Once JIRA Classic ceases to exist - the way we work will no longer be supported by JIRA at all. We are thus forced to stay on an older version of JIRA. 

We would like to be able to configure a board to have a specific ranking field other than the global ranking field, just like you can in the current Agile Classic view.
fields.summary: Stakeholder Management via Multiple Ranking Fields

fields.description: For tickets that become Epics, are resolved, or are no longer visible in a Board for some reason, it would be great to have a way to "Remove Flag" (eg, from the More dropdown in Jira)
fields.summary: Ability to Remove Flag outside of Jira Agile

fields.description:
As of now, the [Parallel Sprint|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/JIRA+Agile+Labs] feature is implemented globally (Once you switch it on, it applies to all projects in the Scrum Board).

Is there any plans on implementing this feature at a project level? This will give users the flexibility to choose what projects can have parallel sprints and those which doesn't have.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to have the ability to select the projects that has the Parallel Sprint feature

fields.description:
Could you please modify the scopechangeburndownchart (or sprintreport) REST API to include the current Sum of Time Spent as well as the current Remaining Time Estimate?  There appears to be no other JSON or XML way of extracting this information through JIRA's REST API.

The following URL does not provide this information:
[JIRA-URL]/rest/greenhopper/1.0/rapid/charts/scopechangeburndownchart?rapidViewId=[rapidViewId]&sprintId=[sprintId]

Nor does the Sprint report:
[JIRA-URL]/rest/greenhopper/1.0/rapid/charts/sprintreport?rapidViewId=[rapidViewId]&sprintId=[sprintId]
fields.summary: Modify JSON output of scopechangeburndownchart (or sprintreport) rapid chart to include current Sum of Time Spent and current Remaining Time Estimate

fields.description: It would be great if Sprints have description. That would outline the goal for the particular sprint.
fields.summary: Add description for Sprints

fields.description:
Newly created OD instance with JIRA & JIRA Agile. By default, the Story Points field didn't have any screens associated, making it impossible to do estimates.

After manually assigning default screen in project config, field is accessible.
fields.summary: Story Points field has no screens by default in ondemand

fields.description:
It appears that somehow, JIRA/JIRA Agile is able to get into such a state that the Epic-Story Link is duplicated in the issuelinktype table of JIRA database. 

The following SQL query returns more than one row from database:
{code}SELECT * FROM `issuelinktype` WHERE linkname = "Epic-Story Link" 
{code}

*Symptoms*
* JQL queries using linktype will break (See: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILEKB/Duplicate+Epic-Story+Link+types+in+IssueLinkType+table+causing+errors+in+search+using+has+Epic)
* JIRA and JIRA Agile are unable to retrieve Epic Link data or Epic associations i.e. all issues or stories would appear missing from their epics (See: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILEKB/All+Epic+Link+data+appears+lost+after+upgrade).

*Expected Behaviour*
* JIRA/JIRA Agile should be able to prevent or detect and delete this duplicate linktype entries.

Not quite sure if this should be a JIRA or JIRA Agile issue, but I'd leave developers to decide and move this if necessary. It occurred in a JIRA 6.1.4 instance.

*Workaround:*
Please find workarounds to fix the broken data in the KB article links provided under the *Symptoms* section above
fields.summary: Duplicate Epic-Story Link types should be automatically removed from the IssueLinkType table

fields.description:
Currently, it is not possible to insert Zephyr Test Cycles into Sprints in JIRA Agile. This can be somewhat inconvenient for Zepyhr users who wish to insert a Test Cycle into a Sprint instead of inserting the test cases one by one.

Also, when work is done on the Test Cycle, the Sprint should update as well.
fields.summary: Integration between Zephyr Test Cycles with Sprints

fields.description:
While the issues in Epics panel can be manually moved to be reordered, this is not a good way to sort when there are many Epics issues.

It would be better the isses in Epics panel can be ordered and/or filtered by applying a filter.
fields.summary: Sort or rank Epics in the panel

fields.description: Once a sprint has been completed, there is no way to delete it from the Agile Board view. It seems to always be available in the dropdown. When starting to setup our instance, we created a test sprint that we no longer want to see in the drop downs.
fields.summary: No Way to Delete a Test Sprint

fields.description: As an administrator, I would like to sort the sprint report by rank.
fields.summary: Ability to sort sprint report by rank

fields.summary: recurring Firefox script errors on agile dashboards

fields.description: After each epic creation all of my required fields are again became invisible. I have to reconfigure the fields I want to view in the Epic Create Dialog.
fields.summary: Epic Create Dialog does not save configured fields on Plan Mode

fields.description:
Currently, you only get the "release" button on the done column of a Kanban board.

In Scrum, you get to plan your versions better (across multiple sprints). But there is no "release" button on each version. It seems the only way to release a version is to do it from the "Manage Versions" page.

From a Scrum board, it takes multiple clicks to get to the "Manage Versions" page - and it's not clearly signposted that you need to / how to get there.

This seems stupid. You can create versions, and edit version details from the plan mode of a Scrum board.

You should at least be able to get to the "Manage Versions" page with one click from the Versions panel on the the Scrum board, or release a version directly from the board.
fields.summary: Improve releasing versions from a scrum board

fields.description:
Would be great to be able to see what the various card colours are without heading into the board configuration which is not discoverable for team members who have never set up a board before.

Thanks,
Nick

Acceptance Criteria:
* modal with card colours
* access via Board dropdown
fields.summary: As a team member I want a card colour reference guide

fields.description:
This is inconsistent behavior, but I have observed the following:

Steps to reproduce:
Create stories in Jira Agile backlog
Estimate and add to sprint
Start sprint
In either Plan view or Work view, select a story link to view in right pane.
Click '...' icon and select Edit from the menu.
Observe Summary field is replaced with the word 'true'.

OS: OS X Mavericks
Browser: Chrome 31
Jira Agile: 6.3.3
Jira: 6.0.3
fields.summary: When editing story in Detail View, Jira Agile users should not see Summary field auto-replace with 'true'

fields.description:
I followed the following documentation to deactivate a user: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Users#ManagingUsers-Deactivatingauser. I cannot find a place to deactivate a user as the checkbox(?) does not appear.

I would much prefer to deactivate as opposed to delete the user. 

Thanks,

David Kearns (david.kearns@logicsupply.com)
fields.summary: Need to be able to deactivate users

fields.description:
Both current filter results that have worked in the past and new filters that I create suddenly fails, and refuses to display the result.

Example: http://i.imgur.com/VSujEE6.png
Example#2: http://i.imgur.com/BuMvuYs.png

The errors listed makes no sense, and the filters work just fine when displayed in the JIRA issue filter.
fields.summary: The Filter results-macro in Confluence has stopped working

fields.description:
When you move an Issue into a Sprint, it does not affect the Ranking value.

This story is to investigate the possibility of having this behavior changed.
fields.summary: As a Scrummaster, it would be useful to have issues added to a Sprint, ranked higher than issues in the backlog

fields.description:
Currently (at least with 6.2), fields added to the [Issue Detail view|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Configuring+the+Issue+Detail+View] are always shown, regardless of whether they have a value or not. Fields without value are usually shown as {color:gray}_None_{color} or  {color:gray}_No content_{color}.

We use some custom fields (mostly text) to add additional informations for our developers; which may not be known/available or relevant for every issue. Along with other fields, this turns out to add a lot of fields that just show "No Content" before the relevant parts start.
The Detail view would end up a lot more compact and terse if just the entered information is shown, rather than everything thats configured.

One field that already does that is the Epic field (provided by GH/Agile), which is not shown when the issue is not part of an Epic.

Depending on what you think of that, empty fields should either be hidden by default (which is probably easier to implement and understand) or configurable from the Board management page (which makes things more flexible, but is probably more difficult to maintain/understand).
fields.summary: As a GH/Agile User, I would like to hide empty fields in the Issue Detail view

fields.description:
In Scrum board, if there are multiple columns configured for a board but one of them does not have workflow statuses associated to it, then this column does not show up in work mode.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a Scrum board
# Configure the board to add some columns
# Map workflow status with the columns leaving out one column
# Switch to work mode. The column with no workflow does not show up on the board.

This behaviour might be logical but is not intuitive for the customers. There should be a help tip to explain this better.
fields.summary: Column missing from Work mode if no workflow status is mapped to it
Allow translation on GH managed custom fields.

fields.description:
I have created a custom field of type "scripted field", which results in the total time spent on an issue. I want this field to be shown in the detail view of an issue on the work board in jira agile, but this does not work. I have found this on the internet:

https://jamieechlin.atlassian.net/browse/GRV-298

Can you please allow scripted fields to be added to the details view or explain to me how i can achive to show the total time spent on an issue in the details view? 

Thanks a lot.
Christoph
fields.summary: Please allow to add scripted fields to the issue details view

fields.description: We use the swimlanes to reflect the branches we're working on issues. This works really great but has the disadvantage, that the swimlanes aren't shown, if they are empty. As we don't want to use numbered branches, it would be really cool, to have the possibility to show all swimlanes even if they are empty, if I want.
fields.summary: As an agile team member I need to be able to see all swimlanes on a board even if they're empty.

fields.description: I really miss the possibility to add sticky notes (at least one ;)) to issues on the board to reflect instantly important information (e.g. which testing environment is used). Having the possibility to add a small image (instead of text) would also be cool.
fields.summary: As a agile team member I need sticky notes on issues on the boards.

fields.description: It would be great if we can have a filter for projects in the Rapid Boards. It will be something like the Quick Filters, but instead of create one quick filter for each project, can be one select menu to select the project (it will be better if we have dozens of projects in the board).
fields.summary: Project quick filter in JIRA Agile

fields.description:
Whenever I try and load any "Agile" page of Jira, it constantly reloads, making it look like it's blinking.

http://makeagif.com/i/hV69mv
fields.summary: Agile Screen Constantly Refreshing

fields.description:
When I switch from my Dashboard to Agile (by clicking on the drop-down in the top right corner) the page constantly reloads

http://makeagif.com/i/hV69mv
fields.summary: Screen Keeps Reloading

fields.description:
When managing cross projects rapid board, user would like to hide certain version off the board to avoid confusion for the product owner.

Use case:

* https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=560&view=planning&selectedIssue=CONF-31106&versions=visible

Similar to our own board, it shows all the versions from all project which is a bit confusing. User should be able to select which project's version to refer to.

Actual quotation from customer based on this use case:

{quote}
The product owner has visibility over the ongoing sprint which contains tickets from both projects, can rank CONF tickets up to fix them faster, but can't really use the release management part of the board as the version tab is full of Confluence fixversions. If they'd add CQ-13 to a CQ fixversion, it was quite uncomfortable. You should see the next fixversion you want to release on top of the list. Even if the board had a quickfilter to hide CONF tickets to do the release planning, the CONF fixversions remain.
{quote}

*Additional Information*

Helpful customer also feedback that alternative to this is by implementing the hide based on the quick filter query, meaning when searching for project = projectA, the project B version will be hidden.
fields.summary: Ability to Hide Version on Multiple Projects Rapid Board

fields.description:
As a Product Owner, when dragging/dropping stories to versions and epics, the Detail View keeps on popping up, stealing screen real estate.

I'd like to have an checkbox to disable the Detail View per Agile Board (Kanban + Scrum).
fields.summary: Add "Disable Detail View" option to Agile Board admin pane

fields.description:
As a Jira Admin,
I want to enter org-wide days off only once, and share them across all teams,
So that I do not have to enter the same set on each Agile Board.

AC:
A. In a central config, enter Standard Working Days once org-wide.
B. In a central config, enter Non-Working Days once org-wide.
C. On any Agile Board, optionally include org-wide Standard Working Days.
D. On any Agile Board, optionally include org-wide Non-Working Days.
E. On any Agile Board, optionally include extra or override one-off Standard Working Days (per current feature).
F. On any Agile Board, optionally include extra or override one-off Non-Working Days (per current feature).

-Johnny
fields.summary: Share Working Days info across Agile boards

fields.description:
I want to be able to:
- display a list of Sprints, including their start and end dates, status (planned, open, closed) etc.
- export that list for reporting purposes.

Added on {{27-November-2015}}
Use case:

It will be useful for the manager to check and follow up with scrum masters 
Having that will be able to know the status of the sprint and the due time easier
fields.summary: As a project manager, I want to be able to view the list of Sprints in a Project

fields.description:
If I close a story that has story points as "Won't Fix" or "Duplicate" it still shows up in the green field at top of Greenhopper as finished story points. I expect the system to ignore those as it is not really completed. 

In the reports it is correctly handled:)
fields.summary: Closed (Wont Fix) tickets are still counted in the backlog overview

fields.description:
When exporting issues, we can see the "Sprint History" of an issue, but this does not indicate that an issue is currently in an Active Sprint, it just tells you that it was at some point in time.

We would like to see a column called "Active Sprint", with the name of the sprint in it.

If the issue is removed from the Sprint this field should be cleared.
fields.summary: Exported issues should indicate if issue is in an active sprint

fields.description:
The "Go To Board" link on an issue takes a long time, and sometimes times out. We have 650K issues, a few hundred boards and the issues are often on 3 to 5 boards. The boards generally only have a few hundred issues in them.

Does the underlying code for GHGoToBoard.jspa simply examine all boards and see if the issue id is in each board's filter? If so, I think there is a scaling problem coming up.
fields.summary: "Go To Board" very slow

fields.description:
Classic boards, in terms of information, were better than the new burndown chart.

We've lost some important information. On Classic Boards we had 5 (colored lines), besides forecasts, with lots of information such as:
1) Remaining Values
2) Remaining Values - Ongoing (dotted line)
3) Remaining Values - Trend (dashed line)
4) Guideline (solid line)
5) Team effort - Completed (solid line)
6) Team effort - Ongoing (dotted line)
7) Estimate accuracy (solid line)
8) Estimate accuracy - Ongoing (dotted line)

The next ones were extremely important for us:
9) Required daily burndown rate (solid line)
10) Required daily burndown rate - Ongoing (dotted line)

Please Atlassian, consider to putting the above information back on the new Burndown Chart.
fields.summary: As a PMO responsible for monitoring projects, mainly burndown charts, it would be great if the information presented on classic burndown could be also presented on the new burndown chart (i.e. [Agile Sprint Burndown Gadget]).
Not enough space to move a sub-task between statuses in a column

fields.description: Please implement the same excel export functionality in kanbank boards as in scrum boards.
fields.summary: Kanban: Select the issue(s) (use Shift>Click or Ctrl>Click) and right-click, then select Export to Excel (see screenshot above).

fields.description:
When trying to add a new column to the workflow an SQL error occurs

Error org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:Status][id,10005][sequence,18][description,This status is managed internally by JIRA Agile][name,Specify][statuscategory,1][iconurl,/images/icons/subtask.gif] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO public.issuestatus (ID, SEQUENCE, pname, DESCRIPTION, ICONURL, STATUSCATEGORY) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "pk_issuestatus"))
fields.summary: When trying to add a new column to the workflow an SQL error occurs
Update information on the 'Using Plan Mode' document

fields.description:
As a scrum master, I would like to be able to create a Scrum board to manage all the scrums.

Currently the scrum master needs to manage the scrum of each project in their board, we would like to have a board to see all project boards.
fields.summary: As a scrum master I would like to create a scrum for scrums.

fields.description:
Enabling language pack crashes JIRA Agile Scrum board in Planning mode.
https://support.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-10184
fields.summary: Language pack crashes JIRA Agile Scrum board. [Transferred from GHS-10184]

fields.description: Now that we have project key rename, it'd be nice to move away from the GHS project key. I suggest use {{AGILE}} as the key.
fields.summary: Rename project key to AGILE

fields.description:
Consider the following situation:

A scrum board, filtered for a particular fix version. Keyboard-only editing.
* highlight an issue in the backlog
* press "e"
* change fix version, it drops from the filter. Next issue in backlog is highlighted.
* press "e"
=> expected next issue, still editing the previous one
fields.summary: Edit shortcut acts on previously selected issue if it dropped out of current filter

fields.description:
Issues and stories can still be added into the Epic that has been marked as Done via the following
* Edit issue screen
* Quick edit in Issue view page

This is because the dropdown list does not remove the Epic that has been marked as Done. 

h4. Expectation
Epic that has been marked as Done should not show on the dropdown list of the Epic Link field.

h4. Workaround
Add issues to Epic via Scrum board since this will not show Epic that is marked as Done.
fields.summary: Prevent issue to be added to Epic that has been marked as Done

fields.description: I want to have text field to input sprint objective. Only sprint name is editable in current version.
fields.summary: As a scrum master I want to set sprint objective when creating sprint

fields.description:
Hi there,
as sprints should be planned by a team and than made "fixed" all users still can put issues into that sprint.

So the feature-Request would be:
Configure a permission which allows a project-role to assign issues into sprints.

Kind regards
André
fields.summary: finer permissions for putting Issues into sprints

fields.description:
Inline editing is not working with some custom fields in agile board which were working few days back.
Please help with this issue.

-Sebika
fields.summary: Inline editing with some custom field in Agile board is not possible

fields.description:
see 
!https://s3.amazonaws.com/uploads.hipchat.com/10804/87880/16rlLDFGBZGwBeD/upload.png!

This is happening because of 
!https://s3.amazonaws.com/uploads.hipchat.com/10804/87880/kOmdxSctKEeUiMB/upload.png!

User who doesn't have access to confluence shouldn't see the button to link sprints/epics to pages.
fields.summary: Error while searching is shown when user does not have access to linked confluence server

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce: 

# With the JIRA Agile addon installed, but not licensed (not sure if this matters), go to "Manage Add-ons"
# Expand JIRA Agile row
# Click "Get Started" button
# New tab opens to RapidStart.jspa
# Instantly redirects to Dashboard

This is happening in Ondemand only.
fields.summary: Get Started button in UPM listing doesn't work.

"for Kanban boards, the dots at the bottom of each issue indicate the number of days the issue has been in its current column. Hover over the dots to see the total number of days" - day's are not shown here in hoover

fields.description:
Hi,
We are happy consumers of Jira and Greenhopper.
I would like to suggest a feature.
Basically, there is no need to compare between teams. Each team calculates its velocity differently and acts different.
Still, we can measure level of commitment of each team and use this as a comparison point between teams and a measurement that combine several existing measurements and appreciate it's level relative to other teams.

For exampls - I would like to calculate level of commitment based on the velocity chart + amount of changes during the sprint (added and removed issues). 

Thanks!
Michal.
<michalep@liveperson.com>
fields.summary: Suggestion for new feature - team commitment chart

fields.description:
The layout of each individual card (ticket) in the kanban board of JIRA Agile is kind of large (although not containing much information). This means that if a column has many cards the height of the layout soon gets too big for one screen, which forces the user to do a lot of scrolling, which in turn makes the board hard to overview. 

I suggest adding a feature to let the user chose between a nomal and a contracted layot for the kanban and scrum boards in JIRA Agile. In the contracted layout the cards should look more like they do in the backlog or 
planning view. This feature would make the boards much more usable to us!
fields.summary: Contracted layout of cards in JIRA Agile boards

fields.description: When i create an issue in Jira agile, if i enter an estimated time and while reviewing all the fields before submission realise i need to change the issue type (e.g. from "Bug" to "New Feature") as soon as i do, my estimated time field gets erased. Is there any way to avoid this happening, because it's quite frustrating!
fields.summary: Issue creation estimated time issue

fields.description:
Hello. I've been getting increasingly frustrated with the short time-outs that are occurring on our OnDemand Jira instance. I don't know how long it is, because it seems intermittent - I typically am having to log in 3 or 4 times a day, yet i can leave my computer for the evening, come back in the morning and i'm still logged in which makes little sense to me. 
According to this post ( https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/44993/can-you-change-the-default-session-timeout-length ) the way to get this increased is by raising a support ticket, so that's what i'm doing.

Please can you set our session time-out to something more reasonable, such as 6 or ideally 12 hours. Thanks!
fields.summary: Please increase our On-Demand Session Time Out

fields.description: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-10112
fields.summary: After create issue, Jira Agile doesn't recognize Version.  Only after Drag Drop does it work.

fields.description:
It would be very helpful for the users of the board to have a clear explanation of what the colours mean in the specific board.

Different boards can have different set-up so it would help a lot.

Either a legend box or a tooltip when you hover over the colour would be equally helpful.
fields.summary: Add some form of legend to describe the meaning of Card Colours

fields.description: When selecting which Time Tracking to show in the burndown chart, I currently have the option to choose between 'None' (which is actually Original Time Estimate) and 'Remaing estimate and time spent'. I would actually like a chart that shows all these lines.
fields.summary: Combined burndown view

fields.description:
I am using an Agile Board which is used to display several projects. I have one quick filter set for each of these projects.
So, when I use a quick filter to see only the User Stories of only one of the projects, I still see all Epics of all projects. As an Epic is only a task part of a project, I would be expecting that the Epics would be filtered as well.

The result is that I end up with a very long list of Epics and I have no way to filter them out.
fields.summary: As a Product Owner, I would like to have Epics filtered by the Quick Filters

fields.description:
When conducting an advanced search the returned information under the 'Sprint' column displays the Sprint Name however if you display that saved filter within a wiki page using the jiraissues macro it displays the Sprint ID within the 'Sprint' column.

Example of macro on the wiki
{jiraissues:title=Theme/Epic/Story within Sprint17|columns=type;key;summary;component;status;assignee;sprint;fixVersion;Story Points;Epic Link;rank|url=https://jira.COMPANYXYZ.com/jira/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/20533/SearchRequest-20533.xml?tempMax=1000}

As the Sprint ID information is not intuitive and doesn't provide any relevance to the Sprint Name it is not found to be valuable to the End Users. So can we make this configurable or have the Sprint Name as the default Sprint display information.
fields.summary: As a Program Manager I would like to see the Sprint Name (as opposed to Sprint ID) displayed in search returns

fields.description:
As a Program Manager I would like to have access to a basic Agile Board Report that displays a table of information on the no. of open tasks per person per sprint along with the total task hrs for the tasks of that assignee.

This request has come up from tens of people within my organisation and is crippling our ability to have quick access to this information without having to perform an extract of information from a sprint to excel where the data is transformed and then placed on a wiki for the team to view it.

Table Column headers required;
i-Assignee
ii-Total Task Count  (for that assignee)
iii-Original Estimate (hrs)   (for all tasks assigned to that assignee)
iv-Time Spent (hrs)   (for all tasks assigned to that assignee)
v-Remaining Estimate (hrs)   (for all tasks assigned to that assignee)
vi-Remaining Days in Sprint
vii-Original Assignee Capacity to the Sprint
vii-% Assignee Capacity Remaining

The first 5 pieces of information comes directly from jira but the last 3 are outside of jira.
In an ideal world I would like to define all 8 pieces of information in jira but if the first 5 could be available I would be a great start.
fields.summary: Sprint Report per Assignee to return total task count and total task hours
Enable sorting by "Epic Link" field

fields.description:
There seems to be no way to attach/detach an issue from given sprint on the issue detail page.

One convenient way would be to add a dropdown field to allow to pick a sprint among the active ones in the issue detail page.
fields.summary: Attach an issue to sprint from the issue page

fields.description: As an Agile practitioner, I try my best to perfectly plan iterations so that Tasks in Jira do not move from one iteration to the next. However, it happens all the time. It would be nice to have a quick visual indicator that shows me which items have been carried over from a previous iteration.
fields.summary: Identify carryover Jiras

fields.description: I can not add a peer programmer on the agile board; now we have to create a  board with sticky's just to overcome this issue.
fields.summary: Add a peer programmer to a task on the agile board

fields.description:
In particular, being able to display things like Story Points in the tabular column listing, instead of in the detail area - would make certain planning operations much easier. 

Having this as general functionality for customizing the view would be best.
fields.summary: Would like to be able to add columns to the Plan view for Agile

fields.description: Adds an easy visual indicator to differentiate between story completion and scope change.
fields.summary: Change Burndown line on chart to be slope to designate burndown and step to designate scope change

fields.description:
*Current behaviour:*
Currently, the actual behaviour of the JIRA Agile version report would be showing the result progressively from the start date itself.

*Intend behaviour:*
 It would be better if we can project the whole duration/release period from the *start date* till the *end date* so that it would be easier to keep track and understand the progress of the report.
fields.summary: Jira Agile version report to project the whole release period from start date till end date
Delete column trigger is quite large

fields.description:
Today we export the value of these fields as simply:
* issue key of Epic linked to an issue
* ID of the sprint

We can supplement this information with the "display name" of those values, so that consumers of XML views of issues can better render the values. An example of this is Confluence's Issues Macro.
fields.summary: Improve the XML view of the Epic Link and Sprint custom fields so that the Confluence Issues Macro can present better information
